alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 24 at 10:40AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. Martin Creek will rise over the next several days. It could reach minor flood stage late Wednesday. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flood stage; minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM PDT Monday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 3.9 Mon 10 am PD 4.1 4.2 5.2 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
